pr_title: DynamoDb mapper: non-blocking asynchronous support for all operations

timeline.message: DynamoDb mapper: non-blocking asynchronous support for all operations
DynamoDb mapper: non-blocking asynchronous support for all operations

timeline.bodyText: In the current version of the interface AsyncMappedDatabase, the table method takes a table name and a schema. I don't think there is a table(schema) method?
timeline.author: cenedhryn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,89 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2010-2020 Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved.
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License").
+ * You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * A copy of the License is located at
+ *
+ *  http://aws.amazon.com/apache2.0
+ *
+ * or in the "license" file accompanying this file. This file is distributed
+ * on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either
+ * express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing
+ * permissions and limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package software.amazon.awssdk.extensions.dynamodb.mappingclient;
+
+import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
+
+import software.amazon.awssdk.annotations.SdkPublicApi;
+import software.amazon.awssdk.core.async.SdkPublisher;
+
+/**
+ * Asynchronous interface for running commands against an object that is linked to a specific DynamoDb secondary index
+ * and knows how to map records from the table that index is linked to into a modelled object.
+ *
+ * Typically an implementation for this interface can be obtained from a {@link AsyncMappedTable} which in turn can be
+ * obtained from a {@link AsyncMappedDatabase}:
+ *
+ * mappedIndex = mappedDatabase.table(tableSchema).index("gsi_1");

replies.bodyText: I'm going to remove the code examples, because it's too difficult to keep them up to date as we iterate on usability. Maybe we will add them back in once we've locked the interface.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Same as above, reference to table method should have two parameters.
timeline.author: cenedhryn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@

+ * express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing
+ * permissions and limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package software.amazon.awssdk.extensions.dynamodb.mappingclient;
+
+import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
+
+import software.amazon.awssdk.annotations.SdkPublicApi;
+import software.amazon.awssdk.core.async.SdkPublisher;
+
+/**
+ * Asynchronous interface for running commands against an object that is linked to a specific DynamoDb table resource
+ * and therefore knows how to map records from that table into a modelled object.
+ *
+ * Typically an implementation for this interface can be obtained from a {@link AsyncMappedDatabase}:
+ *
+ * asyncMappedTable = asyncMappedDatabase.table(tableSchema);

replies.bodyText: Will remove the code example.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: InjectMocks is new to me, pretty neat. It seems to be not loved by everyone (whatever is), this is an interesting read: https://tedvinke.wordpress.com/2014/02/13/mockito-why-you-should-not-use-injectmocks-annotation-to-autowire-fields/
timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: I use it when it's convenient, when it breaks (because you add a new dependency without mocking it in your test) in TDD you normally write a test first for that new dependency and so the silent failure hazard doesn't really apply. I'm going to leave as-is, but it's a good call-out and something to be aware of when using it.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.message: DynamoDb mapper: non-blocking asynchronous support for all operations
DynamoDb mapper: non-blocking asynchronous support for all operations

timeline.bodyText:
The javadocs will not render as nicely as this on javadocs site without html tags such as
  1. . :) I noticed

    is missing in other places as well.
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Honestly all the javadocs need a final look/touchup and review. We have a separate task for that. I'd rather tackle it there than in a piecemeal fashion as a lot of these new classes are mirrored by their sync versions.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: I'd prefer making it right while we are at it because it's really easy to miss when we do it afterwards. This is not blocker of this PR if we can make sure we go over all of them later.
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Given that we have a task already in our backlog specifically for this, I'm going to defer for now so as not to hold up this change.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: I think the naming convention for the static factor method is create.https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java-v2/blob/master/docs/design/FavorStaticFactoryMethods.md#naming-conventions
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: We have a separate backlog task to fix this. Right now the goal of this change is to remain consistent with what's already there.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Will fix.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: As discussed offline, I'd prefer wrapping the Function with a class to make it more readable. Fine with it since this will be an internal api.
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Going to table this for now on the understanding that the future of this interface is to be internal.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText:
final.
Can also we add javadocs to all public apis?
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Will fix.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Will fix.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: nit: We can use Validate.mutuallyExclusive for this
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: I'll look into that, sounds very fixable.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: Decided not to do this after looking at the implementation of mutuallyExclusive. I think it's overkill for just checking two things.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Is this class a public api? Asking because the ctor is not public and has multiple parameters.
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: It has a builder, and it's implementing a public interface. We should iron this out either in the builder style task or the overall surface area audit we plan to do. I don't think we should tackle it here and now as part of the async change (this class just mirrors the existing sync version)
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: We should probably move it to internal package.
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: I don't want to tackle that as part of this change. This class is in the right place based on the current structure of the package (it's a kind of mirror of the pre-existing TransformIterator), but I agree that we should eventually refactor these package names once we have finalized what's internal and not.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: Sounds good.
replies.author: zoewangg

timeline.bodyText:
Can we add some javadocs to this class?
It seems like this is a generic publisher; should we move it to core?

replies.bodyText: If we move this to core, I don't think it can be internal anymore? I'll add javadoc.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: I'd vote for moving it to core and making it protected api. Not a blocker of this PR. We can probably add a todo there
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: I'll add a todo.
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.bodyText: Same question, will this class directly be used by customers? the ctor is not public
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: It's implementing a public interface. The class itself doesn't need to be public. We should review all the classes in one go as a separate task for surface area, I'd like to defer on this for now.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: I see, so this is more like a test api? Can we annotate it with @SdkTestInternalApi to make it more clear?
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: No, definitely not a test class, it's roughly analogous to DefaultS3Client implementing S3Client. We'll correctly categorize it when we execute the backlog item to audit surface area of all classes.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: I meant adding the annotation on the ctor if it is only used for testing.
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Oh no sorry I was looking at the wrong thing. This object is created by a DynamoDbAsyncMappedTable when table(...) is called. The constructor is package protected to prevent direct instantiation from outside of that.
replies.author: bmaizels

replies.bodyText: Sorry when index(...) is called (not table)
replies.author: bmaizels

timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Will fix.
replies.author: bmaizels
